column1: full outside leg stump, clipped down to long leg
back of a length, straight, Bairstow misses his attempt to work to the leg side and taken high on the pad
full at the toes, angling down the leg side, clipped to long leg...clocks in at 91mph
nice piece of timing as he plays forward into a length ball and sends it straight of mid-off
full and straight, 92.8mph, clipped to midwicket
back of a length outside off, left alone, carries at waist height to the patched up Tim Paine
short of a length, at off stump, defended
just short of a length, Bairstow swings away a pull which goes quite fine towards long leg...takes more bottom edge than middle
top shot! A full delivery at off stump, Bairstow gets a stride forward and drives it straight of mid-off
played on the up this time, wasn't quite as full, bat twists a touch in his hands and the ball runs to mid-on
full and wide, flayed over the covers! Wasn't a million miles from a diving Agar as he flew to his right but Bairstow just placed it well enough as he threw his hands through the delivery
straightens the line but that's a wonderful piece of timing as he flicks the wrists and sends it between midwicket and mid-on. Bairstow is up and running
back of a length outside off, defended to backward point
offers up some width outside off, Roy drives hard and it flies off a thickish outside part of the bat over backward point. Third man, Andrew Tye, gets a boot to it, old-style fielding!
nicely bowled, short of a length and nips back at Roy, 90mph, defended to the off side
back of a length at off stump, played to mid-on
onto the back foot and punches this into the covers
good shot, and good fielding...Roy gets onto the front foot to a full delivery and drives sweetly, but Stoinis at mid-off does well
swing and a miss from Bairstow as he aims to pull a short-of-a-length delivery, the ball scoots under the bottom edge
good length at off stump, driven to mid-off
a bouncer, the first of the day, angles over leg stump as Bairstow ducs
back of a length outside off, driven square from the back foot to point
a straight delivery, avoiding a driveable length, played into midwicket
can't finish out the over, drops a fraction short, Bairstow is quickly on it and plays a well-controlled pull behind square
full on the pads, that's a gift, clipped sweetly through square leg
short of a length outside off, forced at the top of the bounce with a straight bat back to the bowler
goes for the pull, doesn't get it out of the middle, skews off a top edge over midwicket but has the legs to reach the boundary
he's nailed that one! No doubt that came out of the middle. Short again from Stanlake and it's a crunching pull over deep square leg

huge appeal for caught! Given not out and Paine has called the review straightaway. He's convinced. Terrific delivery, short of a length and nipping back at Roy, cuts him in half. Is it inside edge or trouser pocket? Appears to miss the bat and clip the back leg. Super take, diving to his left, but this won't coun
angled in at off stump, 92mph, full length and driven to mid-on
a bouncer, flies through to Paine, can't be far from a wide but he gets away with it
back of a length outside off, driven from the back foot to cover
just short of a good length, angling in from outside off, driven to mid-off
aims to force this through the off side, takes a thick inside edge into the pads
short, ducked...he has a skiddy short delivery
another short one, Bairstow ducks, and this time he's able to complete a maiden. Good effort
round the wicket, full at middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
goes for an expansive drive and inside edges into his pads
slides on with the arm from round the wicket, defended to cover
touch fuller, driven off the front foot...dot balls lining up
uses his feet, can't quite get to the pitch, tucks it through square leg
down the pitch again, pushes firmly towards mid-on, quick single, the throw deflects off Bairstow so they decline any overthrows
delightful shot! Was a half volley there to hit, Roy gets a good stride forward and dispatches it between cover and mid-off
drags the length back, defended to cover
defended with an angled bat into backward point
that's huge! Way back into the stands over long leg. A short ball, Roy latches on and hooks with immense power. It's tennis season, new balls please!
and he follows it with a crisp back-foot drive! Richardson takes his line outside off, short of a length, Roy on the back foot and goes wide of point
short of a length, straight, defended
pushes a straight delivery back to the bowler
gets well across onto off stump and sweeps this well wide of short fine leg, excellent placement
tries for a repeat of the short, misses out this time, ball skids down the leg side and is called wide

given this time, Agar hits back! Going for another sweep, although Bairstow has called the review. This looked pretty good. Doesn't hit the bat, misses the glove as well. Although the third umpire is checking that again. It's very close to the glove. Missing leg stump! Well, well. The angle, and lack of turn, did for Agar and saved Bairstow
angled into the pads, bunted with a straight bat through the leg side
worked through the leg side

dropped! By Stoinis running back from mid-off. Would have been an excellent catch, over his shoulder, running back and he does all the hard work to get there but then can't grab it. Bairstow trying to launch down the ground
insult to injury for Australia as Bairstow not back cuts this between backward point and short third
runs are flowing! Short, wide again from Tye, Bairstow cuts it square through the off side
stands tall and again drives square through the off side to deep point
can't find the gap this time as he steers a length delivery with an open face to backward point
goes for the reverse sweep, plays it into the ground and bounces to point
driven to mid-on
dragged down a touch shorter, angled into the pads, pushed with a straight bat to long-on
too short from Agar and Bairstow puts it away through the covers, wide of the sweeper, more swift footwork to get him into position
gets forward and pushes to the covers
drives a short delivery to deep cover
over the wicket, pushed to deep midwicket
slides into the pads, nudged to midwicket
goes back outside leg stump, Maxwell keeps it tight to the batsman, pushed down the ground
flicks a straight ball into the leg side, they think about the second but Maxwell chases it down
steps back well outside off and slaps this very firmly back to the bowler
fired towards leg stump and follows run as he tries to pull
full and straight, drives with a thick inside edge into the pad and it bobbles to the off side
full at middle and leg, pushed to cover
drives down to long-off and that's a 39-ball fifty for Bairstow as his supreme form continues. That knee's okay today
good length outside off, defended
steps back outside leg stump to free up the off side, drives to deep cover from what was a pretty straight delivery
that's a mighty blow over long-on, he rocks back in the crease and heaves it with a straight bat down the ground. Hundred up for England
tucked through midwicket and that's swift running
short of a length outside off, pushed to deep cover and that's fifty for Roy off 41 balls. Excellent follow-up to the century
that's just eased over wide long-off! Dismissive batting. Moves to the leg side, opens up the off, and drives inside-out over the off side
shorter, flatter, puihed off the back foot to the covers
pushed down the ground to long-on
back of a length at off stump, pushed into the covers
short of a length outside off, cracked off the back foot to cover
flat-batted straight of mid-off! An extraordinary shot from Roy. Was short of a length outside off, he plays it off the back foot straight back past the bolwer
short, at the body, angled down to third man
back of a length, 89mph, straight, pushed to mid-off
cuts a shortish delivery into the ground and it bounces towards point
superb fielding! Bairstow pulled a short ball through square leg, was in the air for a while but never catch, however Short pulls off a brilliant one-handed save
flicked off the stumps into midwicket
short of a length, 79mph, pushed off the back foot towards mid-on
gets beaten over the top edge as he drives on the up outside off
full at off stump, a very good-looking drive which finds mid-off on the edge of the circle
flayed over the off side off the front foot
deflects off his thigh pad down by his feet and he's called through for a quick single
short outside off, left alone
more good fielding on the boundary, clipped sweetly off the pads behind square, appears it will bisect long and deep square but D'Arcy Short again the man with the dive
short on the pads, worked out to deep square leg...scamper back for a second. These two are quick between the wickets

just clears mid-off and the boundaries keep coming...the bottom hand takes over as he drives this full delivery, a flick of the wrists to get it over the infield, and he just gets the elevation needed
full, worked off the pads to deep square
push-and-run towards mid-off
back of a length at off stump, pushed down the ground to long-off
plays it down by his feet, doesn't take any bat, comes off the thigh pad
stand and deliver! An effortless, lofted straight drive as Tye goes full and it's into the stands over long-on
full outside off, driven down the ground and long-on can't stop the second
full outside off, a slower ball, driven off the toe end to mid-off and that's the 150 up
hammered through the leg side! Short of a length outside off, Bairstow fetches his pull well in front of square
fuller, worked off the pads through midwicket, wide of long-on to his right this time. Terrific placement
full at off stump, driven to cover
back of a length, straight, nudged to deep square
pulled down to long leg

has he run himself out?! Yes, he has A break for Australia and Roy is well short. Wasteful from him, but it's Short at deep square again who's pulled off the run out. He's been superb the last few overs. Roy was the one who called for the second. Short's arm is excellent. A risk England didn't need to take
short ball first up to Hales, outside off, he ignores it
good length ball, gets forward and pushes to point
full outside off, driven to mid-off
calmly driven into the covers
square driven to point
onto the front foot and pressed into the off side
squeezed back past the bowler, who is really rattling through this over
on the back foot, punched firmly back past the bowler once more
down on one knee, and slapped handsomely through midwicket! A clumping finish to an otherwise effective over
tucked to the leg side
sweet timing and placement! Straying onto the pads and just eased in front of midwicket... no stopping that!
this is some stunning timing from Hales! So little wrong with the delivery, but Hales' timing and placement was out of this world! Clean through the covers
on the back foot, solid block down into the crease
outside off, slammed through backward point
banged in short, too short
on the pads, clipped through backward square
short, wide, battered through point! This is brutality
a play and a miss! Outside off, a flat-footed poke to a good-length delivery
well bowled again! He's found a nice length here, angling into the batsman and sneaking past the edge again
flogged off the back foot to the cover sweeper
attempted pull but he's through the shot too soon. Paine does well to snaffle the deflection off the thigh pad with a stretch to his right
that first shot was merely a dress rehearsal! Short once more, Bairstow nails this one clean into the midwicket stands!
nurdled off the legs
clipped urgently to the leg side, but just the single there
looped into the toes, and flicked out to midwicket. Effective stuff so far...
attempted sweep, rattles off the pad, looking for the single but it's not on there
in the slot and over extra cover! A fine crowd catch to complete the show. England just keep rampaging onwards
tapped into the covers. It's been a decent over, but it's still gone for 10...
a looping slower ball, picked from the hand and punched into the off side
back of a length, angled into the legs, dabbed back down the track
firm defence on the back foot, this is good bowling
good areas once again, as Hales clips firmly off the legs but straight to short midwicket
slower ball, right up in the blockhole, and duly blocked
thumped firmly to mid-off, just a single off the over! Shocking
attempted sweep but can't get it away
decent length, tucked to leg for the single
down on one knee for the sweep, struck outside the line as the ball deflects to the man on the 45
what a way to bring up the hundred! Clears the front leg and flogs it high over cow corner! His fourth in six innings, and he is absolutely flying!
flicked through midwicket
another pumping drive through long-off! There's no stopping England
cracked hard into the covers
banged in short, slapped dismissively through point
a wristy flick out through square leg
a massive top-edge, but Hales gets away with it! It plops over the short boundary on the Radcliffe Road side, and is very uncomfortably held by a bloke in an Aussie cap ... good effort fella!
tucked out to short midwicket
drilled on the up, but straight to mid-off
tossed up and tucked to the leg side
well bowled, ducking back into Hales who adjusts his stroke to press a back-foot drive to cover
on the toes, clipped to the leg side
too much width once more, but the cover sweeper sprints round to intercept another hooning cut
bosh! In the slot, hammered on the up, clean over the covers!
tickled off the legs, behind square once more
tucked out to the leg side
wider line, chopped straight to backward point
beaten! Hales is struck on the back pad, very adjacent to middle, but it seems to be sliding over
crunched to cover
driven down to long-off
can't beat Maxwell with an inside-out drive
good lord, that is a clean strike! Very little wrong with the ball, but Bairstow stays leg side, frees the hands, and clubs it mightily over long-off!
crashed in front of the midwicket sweeper! Just a fraction too short, and Stoinis pays the price
another spanking drive, but straight at short cover this time
inswinging yorker, but misses the length by just a fraction. Clipped to the leg side, and up comes the 250 ...
swished out through backward square
pushed on the up, angling into the leg side... another single
ab-so-lute-lee massive! Hales shimmies down the track, right to the pitch of the ball, flogs high and violently over the bowler's head to bring up his fifty!
down on one knee, crashed through the leg side
driven on the up, out to deep cover. Good committed fielding to cut off the boundary
on the back foot, clumped to long-on
a pre-meditated sweep, and just short of short fine leg! Bairstow would have been livid to get out that way!
excellent improvisation, as Hales drops for the sweep, finds himself having to adjust for a half-tracker, and hauling a kneeling pull behind square
back of a length, pops a touch, and defended back down the pitch
flogged on the up over the covers!
out to deep cover
too short, sticks in the pitch, lambasted with a cross-batted mow over the leg side!
too wide, slashed through the vacant third man. Australia need 18 fielders to plug the gaps
banged in short, smashed out through the leg side. This is carnage!
down on one knee, pounded behind square!
outside off, and crunched into the off side
full stride, solid defence. A very incongruous stroke in the circumstances!
attempted slash into the covers
round the wicket, angled into the pads
on the legs, worked to midwicket
round the wicket, into the stands! Utterly dismissive, Hales' stance was almost set for the shot before the ball was bowled, in the slot and over midwicket!
banged in short, the angle sends it skidding into another murderous pull through the leg side!
fuller length, outside off, slashed to deep cover
short again, a roundhouse pull, out to deep square leg
pounded high and mightily into the leg side, more height than might in fact ... more of a sand wedge out to no-man's land at cow corner
completely different shot, exactly the same result! A top-edged pull, sails harmlessly out to deep midwicket and plugs between two converging fielders. He's toying with them now!
smashed flat out to deep midwicket ... and Richardson scampers round to intercept! The end of a sensational agenda-setting innings from England's most in-form opener of all time...
outside off, a slashed drive to backward point
pushed onto the back foot, a firm push into the gap to pick off the single
cramped for room on leg stump, and clipped on the up to midwicket
powerfully driven off the front foot,  but short cover intercepts
deflected to the leg side to complete an unusually quiet over
nicely bowled, short of a length at off stump, good bounce, Buttler takes his bottom hand off the bat as he works it to third man
just wide, nearly a catch to short midwicket, Hales clips a full delivery off the stumps and not too far from Maxwell but it races away
back outside off, full, driven to the left of mid-off
tries his first ramp, gets well across outside off to a short ball but can't make contact...called wide
and tries it again! Misses again...this time it's a full delivery, a slower ball, and defeats Buttler's attempted ramp
and there's his first six! Goes make to something a touch more conventional, a smeared pull high over deep midwicket as Stanlake goes short
swings and misses outside off
short of a length, he manages to shovel this through midwicket and almost finds the boundary but the sweeper gets around
short outside off, cut to the cover sweeper
angled into the pads, worked along the ground into midwicket, Head can't stop the second as he chases from inside the circle
shuffles around his crease then pushes a straight ball back to Agar
quite a round-arm delivery, fired in at the stumps, driven to deep cover
angled into the pads, worked to deep midwicket
full at the pads, clipped to long leg
well bowled! Almost does him with the slower ball, 61mph, Buttler drives far too early and inside edges into his boot

taken at long-on! There won't be any fireworks from Buttler today. He gets underneath a full delivery, gets more height than distance, and Finch settles underneath. Another slower ball from Richardson, out of the back of the day, excellent bowling
low full toss, clipped to midwicket, and Morgan might have been out with a direct hit from midwicket. In fact, the dive would have saved him
short, angled down the leg side, Hales pulls, gets the glove, and it evades Paine's grasp...century from Hales from 62 balls
that's a good delivery, full and straight, Hales steers it wide of backward point with an open face. Decent over from Richardson
round the wicket, tucks a straight delivery to the leg side
gets forward and works out to deep midwicket
a bottom-handed flick off the pads to short fine leg
bunts a straight delivery down the ground
dragged down short, pulled through midwicket without quite timing it perfectly
short, fired down the leg side, Paine can't it so it's a wide and another bonus run as well
works this out to deep midwicket
a short ball, Morgan whips through pull, finds deep square leg...that's 350 up
a short ball, slower delivery, Hales rolls his wrists and helps it to long leg
gets forward and drives a length ball on the up to cover
short of a length outside off, cut into the pitch off the bottom edge and bobbles towards point
well bowled, another slower one into the pitch, Hales is defeated as he plays the pull and takes a blow in the ribs

he does well to reach this, wasn't that wide, a low full toss outside off, but he was moving to the leg side. Hales throws his bat out and manages to deflect it between short third man and backward point
Hales could be run out here...Morgan drove this off the back foot into the covers, excellent work by Stoinis who then hits direct while kneeling on the ground, but Hales' long reach saves him
huge full toss as the slow ball comes out wrong from Tye, Morgan runs it to third man
that's well bowled, full outside off, Hales can only swing it to square leg
slashes at some width and it skews off the top edge down to third man
round the wicket, latches onto a short ball, pulls it miles back over deep square leg
another short one, angled into leg stump, hooked down to long leg
low full toss outside off, driven from the toe end wide of the cover sweeper
he's through his short ball and taken on the body
full outside off, dragged through midwicket, wide of  the diving man inside the circle
back of a length outside off, a swipe-pull across the line out to deep square
full and straight, Hales gets his feet out of the way and clips to midwicket
high...and higher! Dismissive, again, from Hales as he launches a back-of-a-length delivery over deep midwicket with a golf swing
touch fuller and straighter, heaved into the leg side of a thick inside edge. Stanlake has to chase it himself
length ball outside off, driven square through the covers and the sweeper can't stop the second
gets plenty of power despite this being a pretty good full delivery, sends it straight down the ground
width outside off, Hales can only just reach it as he sends it to deep cover
have some of that! Into the second tier of the stand over deep midwicket. Full and straight, Morgan stays still, launches this over the boundary
slower ball dragged down and there's a fumble in the deep as well, Morgan pulls from outside off, and Short is done by the spin at deep square
a wide yorker, but he gets this through the infield as well! Not quite the legs for another boundary but that's England's 400. What a day for them
starts with a dragged down slower ball and, yes, you guessed it, Morgan has deposited it over deep midwicket
and now a low full toss is pumped straight down the ground...Morgan becomes England's leading ODI run-scorer
straight down the ground! Incredible hitting. Stoinis came round the wicket, offered up a length ball, Morgan lofted it back of his head
he's done it! Low full toss outside off skewed down to third man and that's a 21-ball fifty for the captain. England's fastest in ODIs
over the wicket, short outside off, jumps in the air and flat-bats through the covers
slower ball banged in, Hales swats away a pull, he's off his feet again, goes one bounce to deep square
full, straight, driven powerfully down the ground, one bounce to long-on
another six for the captain as he creams another length ball down the ground, evades a diving Maxwell as he runs across
and this is huge over deep midwicket as Morgan takes a length ball over the leg side...500 is on
back over the wicket, low full toss outside off, a skimming drive straight down the ground
full, wide outside off, Hales can't reach it and Paine can't gather either
full and wide, slices his drive to backward point
this time he makes contact with the wide one outside off, flashes it down to third man
short, pulled, skims out to deep midwicket. Unstoppable.
full, angled down the leg side, a slower ball, scoots between Hales' legs
there it is! The MEN'S WORLD RECORD HAS GONE AGAIN. A slower ball into the pads, Hales swings it over deeps quare leg
full, swings into the leg side again, bisects deep square and deep midwicket
gets the yorker in, dug out down the ground
another yorker, at the stumps, worked down to long-on to bring up the 450
full at off stump, actually comes off the toe as he swings out to deep midwicket
full, wide outside off, he walks across the crease and angles down to third man
a slower ball outside off, driven down the ground
well bowled, gets a yorker under Morgan's bat, beats leg stump and then Paine palms it away

caught off a no-ball, called for height...big full toss from Tye, Hales was coming down the pitch, umpire's decide it would have been above waist height in his normal stance. Took a top edge as Hales swung at it.
and the free hit is swung out to deep midwicket
plays over the top of a yorker outside off stump...a few decent deliveries in the last couple of overs
a yorker at off stump, dug out into the off side
taken at deep midwicket...Hales had just started to lose his shape in the last few minutes. He heaves a length delivery a long way into the air and it's comfortably taken
two wickets in two balls...Morgan tries to take this from outside off over the leg side, goes very high in the air and Paine settles under the catch
a low full toss is driven down the ground
full and straight, driven to cover on the edge of a circle
carved over the off side out to deep point
full outside off, steered to backward point with an open face
swings a low full toss out to deep square leg
full and outside off, chopped down to third man
a slower ball banged in short, Moeen has to hold his shot for a moment then hooks to fine leg
taken at deep midwicket, it's another big full toss, and the umpires are checking for height...it's borderline, but this is called no-ball as well. Langer has a rueful smile on the balcony
and the free hit is full outside leg stump, Moeen misses his flick but it deflects off the pad wide of Paine
a slower short ball and it balloons over Moeen's head...called wide on height
he's defeated by another slower ball, full outside off, which he drives over the top of
heaves a length ball high into the leg side, no timing at all, and falls short of long-on
crunches a length ball from outside off straight down the ground, long-off can't stop the second
full, wide outside off, a one handed drive over cover, the sweep cuts it off and despite a fumble keeps them to two
full at off stump, good delivery, driven into the covers
and Moeen is run out by Paine's under arm throw from behind the stumps...Root had a swing and a miss, another slower ball, and Paine shows his ten-pin bowling skills
full outside off, driven to cover on the circle...Tye brings up his century
full outside off, driven into the pitch and it runs into point
driven nicely through the covers, Plunkett chases it down from mid-off
keeps it full, Short gets forward and drives to mid-off
full at the stumps, searching for some swing, again he drives to mid-off
back of a length, straight, pushed to the right of mid-off
full outside leg stump, Head misses his flick and it's called a wide
good length at middle and off, defended into midwicket
driven over cover for six! Full outside off, a hint of swing, a terrific response from Short as he just drives through the line over the off side
and this one is on the up! Challenge laid down by Short. Willey drags the length back but Short just lofts it over the off-side ring. Lovely shot
gets the yorker in at middle and off, dug out towards mid-on
big appeal for lbw, a good length ball that is trapped off the inside edge
pushed down the leg side...another wide
gets away with this, a good length angled into the pads, flicked towards short fine leg
back of a length, straight, worked to deep square leg. Willey's first over goes for 15. They need a few more of them
width, slashed. High over cover! Australia still on the rampage!
tighter line, on off stump and stoutly blocked
onto the front foot, and clumped into the covers
sharp bouncer, Short swings into a pull but it's through him
back of a length, on the pads, tucked to square leg
leaning back to dab through third man
chipped in the air, and that is as tame as a fluffy pet rabbit! Through the shot too early, Moeen stoops at mid-on, and Short is gone!
clipped to the leg side
swinging into the pads, nurdled off the hip out through square leg
swinging down the leg side, Willey is trying to cramp the left-hander for room, but overcooks it on this occasion
back of a length, on off stump, and jabbed firmly to point
nipping into the pads, and deflected to short third man. They all count
clipped to the leg side
whipped from off stump to backward square, shimmying across the stumps to create the angle. Cleverly played
fuller length, angled across, attacking the top of off, and deflected to backward point
short, sharp, and that's slammed into Head's neck... via the collarbone. Ouch!
crunched hard into the covers
on the back foot, that's a good line to go with the shorter length, and that was 90mph from Wood, who is picking up pace as he finds his rhythm
back-foot punch to mid-off
good zip from Willey, skidding past an attempted cut, too close to make contact
on the pads, clipped to midwicket
good line from Willey, just back of a length, outside off and angling in. Defended back to the bowler
big appeal as Willey nips one back into the pads, he was stuck on the crease, but it looked to be going over
well played, he's picked off that shot well, just walking across the stumps and finding the angle through fine leg
climbing through to the keeper, outside off, but can't make contact
angling into the stumps from round the wicket, tapped to mid-on
makes room for a slash over the covers, doesn't quite connect but finds acres of space out at extra cover, as the ball rolls into the rope
tucked to the leg side
flicked out to the leg side once more
dances down the pitch, looking for something big but settling for a clip to leg
eased down to long-on, singles won't suffice for Australia ... and it's only the seventh over!
a touch of width outside off, and thumped on the up into the covers
width, and crashed into the gap at third man... Australia keep ticking along
sliding down the leg side
flashed into the covers
swinging down leg once more. A bit meh from Willey in this over
up on the toes, that's a better line, and defended back down the pitch
crashed into the covers, a good sliding stop
too much width from Willey, who is caught between swinging down leg and starting too far outside off. It's the latter error this time, and an open-faced glide beats backward point
tremendous use of the feet! Dancing down the deck, right to the pitch of the ball, and slotted back over the bowler's head
fended back down the pitch
speared into the toes, clipped to the leg side
advancing once again, and eased down to long-on
back of a length, tapped to the leg side, they scamper the quick single
short but straight, cut firmly to point
well bowled from Wood, skidding on from a middle-and-leg line, and defended to point
tight lines once more, up on the toes to defend on off stump
well bowled once more, zipping through, and inside-edged through to the keeper, who flings off a glove to take a shy, but the batsman is home
a batsman swing through the line, clean in front of square on the leg side
whipped off the legs to backward square
pushed onto the back foot, fenced to third man. Australia are keeping apace of the requirement for now
stabbed back to the bowler
opens the face to guide the ball to point
defended down the ground to long on
too short and flogged hard along the ground to the midwicket sweeper
tossed up, dipping into the blockhole, enticing stuff
held back a touch in the flight, Head advances and clips to long on
flipped out to midwicket from deep in the crease
pushed off the back foot to mid-off
short and sharp, Head flinches inside the line as the ball gets big on him
sharp pace, but down the leg side. Half an appeal for the strangle down the leg side, but that was mostly to distract from the wide
whipped urgently off the hip to deep midwicket
thumped into the covers and up comes a very well compiled fifty. Head is taking this chase head-on
pulled hard, but straight to the man at midwicket
on the back foot, flicked to the leg side
drawn down the pitch, Moeen holds this one back, and midwicket gathers the delicate flick off the pads
another soft and fluffy dismissal! What a way to give it away. Very full from Moeen, which lures a limp pokey nothing shot, straight back into the bowler's grasp!
pushed out to cover and Stoinis is off the mark
thumped uppishly to long-off
solidly into line
very full, swinging into the pads, and they scamper the single
poked back down the pitch, and Plunkett sticks out a mitt to half-stop
nudged to the leg side
firmly bashed back down the pitch
inside-edge onto the pads as Plunkett comes round the wicket to the left-hander
over the wicket now, and mown out to deep backward square. A good heavy-balled first over

hoisted high and mightily down the ground ... but Plunkett is perched on the rope, and swallows the opportunity! Just didn't quite get enough bat through the ball, and for all Australia's intent, they are in peril now
outside off, and tweaking back into a back-foot push
onto the front foot this time, and pushed to mid-off
delicate from Stoinis, a pre-meditated reverse sweep, gets it very fine, and Rashid can't cut that off
a hint of spin from outside off, Stoinis hits with the turn and places it to mid-on
on the back foot, defended back down the pitch
hoicked behind square
flicked to the leg side
wider on the crease, fuller length, blocked to mid-on
slower ball, on the pads, tucked out to deep square leg
thumped off the back foot, but straight to mid-off
slower ball again, dug into the pitch and hauled into the leg side
massive! Down on one knee, pounded into the stands, where there's a very good crowd catch. Scenes!
worked out to the deep
pushed to cover
back of a length, dabbed to third man
flicked off the toes, out to backward square
opens the face for a glide to third man
short, goes for the pull and it's in the air for a while but short of long leg
good length outside off, pushed to cover for a quick single. There's a direct hit from Morgan but Stoinis well home
full outside off, goes for the drive and it skews off a fat outside edge down to third man
that's a neat pull off the hip down to long leg
short again, a slower ball this time, he's through his shot early and the ball dribbles to midwicket
very full outside off, sweetly driven square of the wicket but well stopped by Roy at point
plays back to a shortish delivery and defends to midwicket
whipped down to long-on
outside off this time, still a touch short, cut to deep cover
fuller, driven down to long-on
goes for a square cut to a delivery that skids on and beats the bottom edge
just short of the bowler as Finch gets a leading edge, looking to work into the leg side, turns the face of his bat, loops down the on-side of the pitch and Rashid can't quite reach it. Good effort
that flies through to Buttler from short of a length, wasn't a full on bouncer, beats the top edge of Stoinis who wanted the wide call
fuller, angled into the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
gets inside the line and nudges this off his hip to deep square and makes it into a second
lovely wrist work from Finch, whips a back-of-a-length delivery behind square on the leg side and he's timed it perfectly
back of a length outside off, he adjust the line, defended to cover
angled down the leg side, that's a poor delivery, doesn't make contact with the bat but deflects off the thigh guard to fine leg
full outside off, driven firmly to long-off but excellent running makes it a brace
good length, straight, tapped to the off side
that's muscled down the ground over long-on...Finch stayed in his crease and just levered through the line from a strong base

done him this time! He tosses it up much slower, Finch goes for another big shot down the ground and is completely done in the air. Lovely stuff from the leggie, even if he does have the cushion of a mountain of runs
full and straight, driven down to long-off
touch short, pulled out to deep midwicket
back of a length at off stump, played to the bowler
takes this from around off stump into the leg side
short at off stump, 83mph, Maxwell defends on his toes towards point and is keen for the run but it's not there
some whippage from Maxwell as he tucks this from outside off to deep square leg
goes for the pull, drags it from outside off, doesn't connect perfectly but it finds space at deep midwicket
that's gone miles in the air! Stoinis unleashes a big drive down the ground, the delivery isn't that full, and it ends up almost plugging in front of the rope but trickles over in the end
full and straight, driven to cover
touch shorter, he goes back on leg stump, crunched very firmly towards cover who takes the pace off it
quite full at leg stump, he plays back and defends
there's the googly, he plays back and punches off the back foot to cover
brilliant work at cover! A flatter delivery is driven firmly and Roy flings himself to his right
there's some power in that! Full, touch too wide outside off, and Stoinis responds with a skimming drive wide of the cover sweeper
over the wicket, outside leg stump, takes the pad towards short fine leg and a poor piece of cricket allows an overthrow as Rashid throws at the stumps and it deflects away
short of a length on the pads, dangerous line, flicked straight to short fine leg. Rashid throws again with the batsman in no danger
straighter line, tucked into midwicket
heaves to the leg side against a pretty full delivery, takes a thick inside edge into midwicket. Willey chases, collects and throws at the stumps himself (worth it on this occasion...just)
short of a length and he cloths his pull to midwicket

he's been run out here! An excellent throw from Bairstow coming in from deep square. Stoinis hopped inside the line, worked the ball to deeps square, Maxwell called him back for the second and he's sold Stoinis well short. Bullet arm from Bairstow. Looks of thunder from Stoinis and Langer
tossed up at the stumps and driven to cover
the bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives in the air over cover
full and straight, pushed down the ground to long-on
goes for the reverse sweep, takes the pad to short third man
pushed into the pads, worked out to deep square
moves outside leg and square drives to the cover sweeper
driven to mid-off
short at the body, knocked down into the leg side
a scoop for six! Moves well across his crease to a back-of-a-length delivery and sends it back over Buttler's head
goes full at off stump, driven to mid-off
full at the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
outside leg stump and flicked to long leg
full at off stump, driven to cover where Roy again fields very well
the googly, he plays back and works to midwicket
waits for this leg-break to turn from off stump but picks out cover off the back foot
full at middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
moves outside leg stump, loses his shape on the drive, bottom hand comes off the bat as it skews to long-off

he's basically pulled a long hop to deep square! Good catch by Hales. A drag down from Rashid, Paine only had one man to beat on the leg side but couldn't keep the ball down and Hales moved to his right to snaffle the take
that's a lovely little shot, a ball angling across him, short of a length, and it's a delicate dab wide of the keeper
backs away to the leg side and drives into the point area
top catch at long-on! A back-of-a-length delivery, into the pitch, Maxwell heaves pretty straight but Plunkett makes good ground to his left and times his leap perfectly to hold in
short from over the wicket, he hops behind the line and defends to the leg side
short outside off, neatly punched from the back foot to deep point
back of a length at off stump, defended
full at off stump, he lunges forward and defends
tossed up, nice flight, straightens a touch and is blocked
a flatter delivery, the googly, played off the back foot to deep cover
nearly flips this up to midwicket, plays back to a shortish leg break and is a little early on his shot
pushed back to the bowler
stretches forward and tucks off the stumps to square leg
full at middle and off, 85mph, defended to mid-on
shuffles across the crease and works a length ball into midwicket
driven to cover
short of a length at off stump, pushed off the back foot to the covers for a sharp single
short of a length, chopped down off a bottom edge
a short delivery, Agar gets inside the line and pulls to deep square
full outside off, driven through the covers
gets a slog-sweep away, wasn't too far away from midwicket, but places it well enough
full at middle and leg, googly, defended
this slides across and bounces a touch more, beats the top edge as he goes for the cut
moves outside leg and pulls to long-on
flicks a straight delivery to deep square
attempts a bended-knee pull shot but this scoots over the top edge
short of a length at off stump, 85mph, defended on the back foot
pushes a back-of-a-length delivery to the covers
short of a length, pulls to deep square
a short delivery, he jumps behind the line and pushes into point. They hurry for the single and Richardson loses his bat as he nears the crease. That might have been out with a hit!
full at leg stump, shoveled to mid-on
comes down the pitch and gets a leading edge over the off side, falls safely as Bairstow comes around in the deep
clears his front leg and drills a full delivery to long-on
steps back to a short delivery outside off, driven off the back foot into the covers, Roy dives and just gets a hand on it
plays back to a googly and square drives to deep cover
that's a nice leg-break! Pitches on off stump and spins considerable to beat the edge
nicely bowled again, almost does him in the flight as he starts to use his feet, blocks to the off side
back of a length, whipped through the leg side, a short-arm pull and it races away
now he back cuts very nicely but it's intercepted by a diving Roy at backward point...he's been busy in the field
goes for the drive and gets an inside edge into his boot
beats the outside edge as he tries to play a forcing shot off the back foot
works a back-of-a-length delivery towards mid-on
that's out of the middle! Moves to the leg side then picks up a full delivery with a lovely swing through the line. As big as anything today
driven off the back foot to deep cover
gets forward and drives to long-off
short outside off, driven to deep cover
full outside leg, flicked into midwicket

well held! Rashid's good night continues, as he springs to his right to hold a sharp, low catch. Agar slices across the delivery slightly, came out the front of the hand, miscues it back down the pitch, Rashid takes it very neatly
that's almost a moonball from Rashid (remember Jeremy Snape?) So much air, very slow, loopy doopy, Tye manages to wait and drive to long-off
tucks a straight delivery to deep square
defended back to the bowler
drags this from outside off out to deep midwicket
pushed into the on side
uses his feet and then whips this from outside off wide of long-on...Richardson shapes up nicely with the bat
well, he didn't shape up too nicely there! Oops. A charge down the pitch, head in the air, this is bowled with nice flight, grips and spins between bat and pad. Simple stumping
pushes down the ground to long-on
full at off stump, blocked to point
starts to use his feet, doesn't get to the pitch, nudges to midwicket
worked into square leg
a googly, he plays back and it slides off the face to backward point
and that's all over! Another googly from Rashid, Stanlake lunges out of his crease, spins past the outside edge and Buttler has time to do the rest.
